chiefComplaint: Persistent cough and shortness of breath
assessment: Patient presents with productive cough, fever (101.5Â°F), and decreased breath sounds in right lower lobe. CXR shows infiltrate consistent with pneumonia.
plan: Prescribe Azithromycin 500mg PO x5 days. Order chest X-ray and CBC. Follow-up in 3 days if symptoms persist.
notes: Patient is a smoker (10 pack-years). Advised smoking cessation. Will monitor closely for respiratory distress.

assessment: Patient reports decreased cough and improved breathing. Temperature normalized. Chest sounds improved.
plan: Continue current antibiotics. Return if symptoms worsen.
notes: Good response to treatment. Continue monitoring.

assessment: ECG shows irregular rhythm consistent with AFib. Heart rate 110-120 bpm. No signs of acute MI.
plan: Start metoprolol 25mg BID. Order echo and electrolytes. Refer to cardiology for anticoagulation consult.
notes: Patient has history of hypertension. Will need long-term anticoagulation management.

assessment: Heart rate improved to 70-80 bpm on metoprolol. Patient tolerating medication well.
plan: Increase metoprolol to 50mg BID. Start apixaban 5mg BID for anticoagulation. Echo scheduled for next week.
notes: Good rate control achieved. Anticoagulation initiated.

assessment: Patient with 2-day history of watery diarrhea, cramping, and vomiting. Mild dehydration noted.
plan: Oral rehydration, clear liquid diet. Prescribe ondansetron PRN for nausea. Return if symptoms worsen.
notes: Likely viral gastroenteritis. No antibiotic needed at this time.
